text: It would be nice to get a new PMD for the Switch, it's a refreshing side-series for a franchise that is often criticized as being too safe and conservative. I still have a lot of catching up to do with the mainline games, but how do you guys like Sword/Shield so far?
author: SupraDarky

text: SupraDarky I personally think Sword/Shield is one of the best Pokémon games. There’s definitely a lot you can nitpick but what the game does, it does well.
author: Noah Hughes

text: I don't think sword and shield hit as hard as it could have, needed a deeper story to be honest.
author: Lattaz

text: @Lattaz agreed. It was fun while it lasted, but mind-numbingly easy...
author: Jan

text: Sword/Shield was just a disappointment to me. Waited 2 years for something the could have been much better.
author: Gaming Music Jukebox

text: It's just OK. The second half is very clearly rushed in several areas and it feels like they dumped all the character development in just one kid. Gameplay wise it's fine, it's similar to Gen 7, but it could be better. Wild Area is neato.
author: Hawlo

text: Shit. Shit story, shit graphisms, lazy gameplay and no difficulty. Only good points is this is on the switch and the new generation of pkms
author: Histoiresansfin

text: Very good games. Enjoying 'em tons!
author: KalarMar

text:

text: The prophet strikes once again...
author: Tyler Holtz

text: They suck lol. They are so visibly rushed it's almost insulting

text: Ah another lovely theme. Mystery Dungeon series really had some great themes.
author: Azure Alufei

text: Couldn't care less about the mainline, I wish I had played these cool spin-offs, they look like they have nice stories
author: Lucio Fernandes

text: I still don't understand why Arata Iiyoshi is not recognized as one of the best VGM composers af all time...
author: Jerry98

text: I know it's a lot to ask for, but after missing the last 2 mainline Pokemon games, I hope that both a) I get far enough removed from Pokemon, and b) the quality of the games improves to a point that I can just hop into a random game and feel the sense of adventure and living in a "Pokemon World" that I feel has been missing from the last few games. Even now I can see a couple of Pokemon in the picture here that I don't recognize. I just feel like the series has forced itself into creating a decent amount of new Mons for each game instead of focusing on what made the series special in the first place - a strange new world that's populated with wild and fantastical (but somewhat realistic; looking at you Ultra-Beasts) monsters.
author: Spiceandsword

text: I still cry when I hear in the hands of fate blue/red and darkness/time/sky were amazing
author: Rebecca Johnson

text: Though the more recent games really beefed it with the writing and gameplay decisions I still can’t understand when the camera is SO ZOOMED IN
author: Rebecca Johnson

text: Explorers of Sky STILL gets me with its soundtrack man...
